skill.name: code-conventions
skill.description: Guide for code conventions and formatting, especially for projects using Deno. This skill helps maintain consistent code style across projects by providing formatting rules and documentation standards.
skill.summary: Maintains consistent code style and formatting standards for Deno projects
skill.author: 5t111111

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill with no executable code. All static findings are false positives triggered by metadata fields and markdown syntax. The skill contains only guidelines for code formatting and documentation standards.

content.user_title: Enforce Code Conventions and Formatting Standards
content.value_statement: Inconsistent code formatting makes projects harder to maintain and review. This skill provides clear guidelines for code conventions and formatting, helping teams maintain readable and consistent codebases across Deno projects.
actual_capabilities: Provides formatting rules using standard tools like mise run fmt
Establishes JSDoc and TSDoc documentation requirements for all symbols
Promotes consistent English documentation comments across code
Helps maintain readable and maintainable codebases
limitations: Does not execute or modify code automatically
Focused primarily on Deno projects and conventions
Does not enforce conventions through CI/CD pipelines
Relies on manual application of formatting tools

use_cases.title: Onboard New Team Members
use_cases.description: New developers can quickly learn project coding standards by following the conventions guide, reducing onboarding time and ensuring consistent contributions from day one.

use_cases.title: Maintain Code Review Consistency
use_cases.description: Reviewers can reference established conventions during code reviews, reducing subjective feedback and speeding up the review process.

use_cases.title: Set Up New Deno Projects
use_cases.description: Developers starting new Deno projects can use this skill to establish coding standards early, ensuring consistency from project inception.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Formatting Check
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the code conventions I should follow for this project?
prompt_templates.scenario: When starting work on a codebase and needing to understand formatting requirements

prompt_templates.title: Documentation Standards
prompt_templates.prompt: What documentation standards should I use when writing JSDoc comments for functions and classes?
prompt_templates.scenario: When writing documentation for code symbols and APIs

prompt_templates.title: Formatting Tool Usage
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I run the code formatter for this project before committing?
prompt_templates.scenario: When preparing code for commit and ensuring proper formatting

prompt_templates.title: Complete Conventions Reference
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me a complete overview of the code conventions including formatting rules, documentation standards, and naming conventions for this project.
prompt_templates.scenario: When needing a comprehensive reference for project conventions

output_examples.input: How should I format my code before committing?
output_examples.output: Always run `mise run fmt` to format your code before committing. This ensures your code follows the project's formatting standards and maintains consistency across the codebase.

output_examples.input: What documentation should I add to my functions?
output_examples.output: Document all functions, classes, and properties using JSDoc or TSDoc comments. Write documentation in English. Include parameter descriptions, return types, and any important notes about behavior.

best_practices: Run formatting tools before every commit to catch style issues early
Document all public APIs with complete JSDoc or TSDoc comments
Write documentation in consistent English throughout the codebase
anti_patterns: Leaving functions undocumented or with incomplete JSDoc comments
Mixing documentation languages within the same project

faq.question: What formatting tool does this skill recommend?
faq.answer: This skill recommends using `mise run fmt` for code formatting, which is the standard formatter for Deno projects.

faq.question: Does this skill automatically format my code?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides guidelines and recommendations. You need to run formatting tools manually or through your editor.

faq.question: What comment style should I use for documentation?
faq.answer: Use JSDoc or TSDoc comments for documenting functions, classes, and properties. Include descriptions, parameter types, and return values.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for non-Deno projects?
faq.answer: The conventions are designed for Deno projects. Other projects may have different tooling and conventions.

faq.question: How detailed should my documentation comments be?
faq.answer: Include descriptions of what the symbol does, parameter meanings, return values, and any edge cases or important notes.

faq.question: What if my team has custom conventions?
faq.answer: This skill provides a baseline. Teams can extend or customize these conventions to fit their specific needs.
